keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour government will raise the minimum wage to £10 an hour for all workers aged 18 or older, abolish zero hour contracts, and ensure equal pay for equal work through strengthened enforcement mechanisms.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Support for Pensioners, Families and Carers
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour government will provide free school meals to all primary school children, raise carers' allowance by £11 a week, and extend paternity leave to 4 weeks.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: The services and homes we need
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour government will join up health and social care services to provide better care for those in need, build more council and private rental homes, and ensure a range of housing to suit different incomes and needs.
Labour government will not raise income tax for those with incomes below £80,000, will introduce an excessive pay levy, and will guarantee no rise in National Insurance or VAT for 95% of taxpayers.

issues.brexitEurope: Labour will work for a Brexit that delivers protections for workers’ rights, standards and our economy.
issues.economy: Labour will not raise income tax for those with incomes below £80,000, guarantee no rise in National Insurance or VAT for 95% of taxpayers, and introduce an excessive pay levy.
issues.education: Labour will provide free school meals to all primary school children.
issues.health: Labour will join up health and social care services to provide better care for those in need.
issues.socialWelfare: Labour will raise carers' allowance by £11 a week, and extend paternity leave to 4 weeks.

housing.content: Labour will build more council and private rental homes, and ensure a range of housing to suit different incomes and needs.

leaflet.additionalNotes: All policies correct at time of printing (12 May 2017).
